title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Legal adviser warns NIH not to kill 900 grants a second time
items.description: Advice follows Supreme Court ruling that threatened previously restored grants, but reprieve may be brief

items.title: Stalagmites reveal devastating droughts that helped spur Maya breakdown
items.description: Series of droughts chronicled in cave rocks likely pushed civilization to breaking point

items.title: Trust in elections rises after ‘inoculations’ meant to preempt false fraud claims
items.description: New U.S.-Brazil study points to ways of countering election misinformation, political scientists say

items.title: Has a huge blob of dark matter been found in our galactic neighborhood?
items.description: If confirmed, vast cloud could test predictions about the Milky Way’s hidden architecture

items.title: AI enters the grant game, picking winners
items.description: Funders test algorithms to spot promising science, raising hopes of faster reviews—and fears of bias

items.title: Attempt to oust CDC director sparks key resignations by agency officials
items.description: Susan Monarez, who clashed with the U.S. health secretary over vaccine policy, refuses to step down

items.title: Mammoths in Mexico? Huge bone trove reveals giant beasts thrived in warmth, too
items.description: Fossils found while building airport contain first mammoth DNA from tropical location

items.title: Erin Brockovich toxic metal detected in air after LA fires
items.description: The unusually tiny particles of hexavalent chromium could pose a health hazard despite low levels, researchers say

items.title: College sports policy prevents athletes’ deaths with sickle cell testing—but it could do more, study finds
items.description: New report recommends improved education and genetic counseling alongside NCAA’s mandated screening

items.title: AI tool labels more than 1000 journals for ‘questionable,’ possibly shady practices
items.description: New algorithm could help scientists avoid publishing in shady titles
